pageDescription: Event actions are used to send events to bots.

comment.shortText:
Performs the given action.
This function can be used to perform actions that you have stored as data without having to find out which function to call. You can find a list of action types [here](https://github.com/casual-simulation/casualos/blob/develop/src/aux-common/bots/BotEvents.ts#L40).
the action that should be performed.

Performs the given action.
This function can be used to perform actions that you have stored as data without having to find out which function to call. You can find a list of action types [here](https://github.com/casual-simulation/casualos/blob/develop/src/aux-common/bots/BotEvents.ts#L40).
Prevents a previous action from being performed.
comment.text: This is especially useful when used in a [`@onAnyAction`](tags:@onAnyAction) listener since it lets you reject actions before they are performed.

comment.shortText: the action that should be prevented/rejected.
Prevents a previous action from being performed.
comment.text: This is especially useful when used in a {@tag @onAnyAction} listener since it lets you reject actions before they are performed.

comment.shortText:
Shouts to all bots that are [`#listening`](tags:listening) and have a listen tag for the specified events until one of the bots returns a value.
Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers [`@onListen`](tags:@onListen) and [`@onAnyListen`](tags:@onAnyListen) for the bots that the shout was sent to.
comment.text: This function is useful when you want to shout but only want one bot to process the shout.

tags.text:
Shout to the first bot that handles @onClick
priorityShout(['onClick']);

Shout to the first bot that handles @myTest or @mySecondTest
priorityShout(['myTest', 'mySecondTest']);

Priority shout with a color
priorityShout(['myTest', 'mySecondTest'], "blue");

comment.shortText: the array of event names that should be shouted. e.g. Using onClick for the name will trigger the [`@onClick`](tags:@onClick) listener until a bot returns a value.
the `that` argument to send with the shout. You do not need to specify this parameter if you do not want to.

Shouts to all bots that are {@tag listening} and have a listen tag for the specified events until one of the bots returns a value.
Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers {@tag @onListen} and {@tag @onAnyListen} for the bots that the shout was sent to.
comment.text: This function is useful when you want to shout but only want one bot to process the shout.

tags.text:
Shout to the first bot that handles @onClick
priorityShout(['onClick']);

Shout to the first bot that handles @myTest or @mySecondTest
priorityShout(['myTest', 'mySecondTest']);

Priority shout with a color
priorityShout(['myTest', 'mySecondTest'], "blue");

comment.shortText:
Sends a shout to all bots that are [`#listening`](tags:listening) and have
a listen tag for the specified name. Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers [`@onListen`](tags:@onListen) and [`@onAnyListen`](tags:@onAnyListen).
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

tags.text:
Send a @reset event to all bots
shout("reset");

Send a @hello event with your name
shout("hello", "Bob");
Event actions are used to send events to bots.

comment.shortText: the name of the shout. e.g. Using `onClick` for the name will trigger all [@onClick](tags:@onClick) listeners.
the `that` argument to send with the shout. You do not need to specify this parameter if you do not want to.

Sends a shout to all bots that are {@tag listening} and have
a listen tag for the specified name. Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers {@tag @onListen} and {@tag @onAnyListen}.
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

tags.text:
Send a @reset event to all bots
shout("reset");

Send a @hello event with your name
shout("hello", "Bob");
Event actions are used to send events to bots.

comment.shortText: Sends a shout to all of the other instances that are loaded.

tags.text:
Send a hello super shout to all the loaded instances.
superShout("hello");

comment.shortText: the name of the shout. e.g. Using onClick for the name will trigger all the [`@onClick`](tags:@onClick) listeners.
the optional `that` argument to include with the shout.
Sends a shout to all of the other instances that are loaded.

tags.text:
Send a hello super shout to all the loaded instances.
superShout("hello");

comment.shortText:
Sends a whisper to all bots that are [`#listening`](tags:listening) and have
a listen tag for the specified name. Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers [`@onListen`](tags:@onListen) and [`@onAnyListen`](tags:@onAnyListen).
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

tags.text:
Send a @setColor event to ourself
whisper(this, "setColor", "red");

comment.shortText: the bot, array of bots, bot [`#id`](tags:id), or array of bot [`#id`](tags:id) that the whisper should be sent to.
the name of the whisper. e.g. Using `onClick` for the name will trigger the [`@onClick`](tags:@onClick) listener for the specified bots.
the `that` argument to send with the shout. You do not need to specify this parameter if you do not want to.

Sends a whisper to all bots that are {@tag listening} and have
a listen tag for the specified name. Optionally includes a custom that argument.
Also triggers {@tag @onListen} and {@tag @onAnyListen}.
comment.returns: Returns a list which contains the values returned from each script that was run for the shout.

tags.text:
Send a @setColor event to ourself
whisper(this, "setColor", "red");
